relations.sentence: JRPG Destiny Connect coming in February At least in Japan.

Text: Markus Hirsilä Published on the 17th of Nov 2018 at 09 Japanese gaming magazine Famitsu has reported that Nippon Ichi Software's "original RPG" Destiny Connect is due to land on February 28 for PS4 and Switch users in Japan, a game that's directed by Yoshihiko Toda and written by Jun Yokota.

relations.sentence: Photo Flash: ONLYHUMAN By Christine Bonansea At Danspace Project

results.text: Mei Yamanaka, Alvaro Estado, Maya Orchin, Becca Loevy, Amelia Heintzelman, Ichi Go, Cameron Mckinney, Charles Gowin, Kristopher K.Q.

semantic_roles.sentence: Share ONLYHUMAN is a dance theater piece by a French-born, NYC-based artist Christine Bonansea.
Inspired by Friedrich Nietzsche's aphoristic volume Human, All Too Human, the work investigates the stark contradiction between our race's capacity for beauty against its most destructive tendencies.

object.text: the stark contradiction between our race's capacity for beauty against its most destructive tendencies

semantic_roles.sentence: ONLYHUMAN also deals with the various perception of a body, from human to post-human.

object.text: with the various perception of a body, from human to post-human

semantic_roles.sentence: Developed in a close collaboration with a stellar group of International Artists , the show is wrapped into a ultra-modern, Matrix-like, futuristic layer of striking multimedia visuals, featuring the lighting design by Solomon Weisband (who recently worked on a major operatic production with Robert Wilson ), with visuals by acclaimed photographer Robert Flynt, video and multimedia by Yoann Trellu, and music by Nicole Carroll.

Inspired by Friedrich Nietzsche's aphoristic volume Human, All Too Human, the work investigates the stark contradiction between our race's capacity for beauty against its most destructive tendencies.

Developed in a close collaboration with a stellar group of International Artists , the show is wrapped into a ultra-modern, Matrix-like, futuristic layer of striking multimedia visuals, featuring the lighting design by Solomon Weisband (who recently worked on a major operatic production with Robert Wilson ), with visuals by acclaimed photographer Robert Flynt, video and multimedia by Yoann Trellu, and music by Nicole Carroll.

Developed in a close collaboration with a stellar group of International Artists , the show is wrapped into a ultra-modern, Matrix-like, futuristic layer of striking multimedia visuals, featuring the lighting design by Solomon Weisband (who recently worked on a major operatic production with Robert Wilson ), with visuals by acclaimed photographer Robert Flynt, video and multimedia by Yoann Trellu, and music by Nicole Carroll.

The dance and features virtuosic, gravity-defying solo part performed by the Japanese dancer Mei Yamanaka; other performers include Alvaro Estado, Maya Orchin, Becca Loevy, Amelia Heintzelman, Ichi Go, Cameron Mckinney, Charles Gowin, Kristopher K.Q.
Danspace Project at St. Mark's Church 131 East 10th St., New York, NY 10003 November 15-17, 8pm.
